main event: An elongated, soft yellow light was observed moving through the atmosphere at an estimated speed of 3,500 mph in Vandalia, Ohio on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as an elongated, soft yellow light similar to a starlike object.
The object remained steady in size and intensity and was sighted for 15 seconds.
No sound was reported from the object.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 3,500 mph, suggesting a very small object moving at a tremendous rate of speed.
The witness was a former Navy man and farmer.
